articles.title: U.S. Delegation Here
articles.content:
U.S. Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Asia Society of the United States led by Chairperson Vishakha Nirubhai Desai arrived here by air on Monday.

articles.title: Greetings to Eritrean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Eritrean President
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Issaias Afewerki, president of the State of Eritrea, Monday on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of its independence.
					 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger as the days go by, the message wished the people of Eritrea greater progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Victory of Socialism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Victory of Socialism
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Transition from capitalism to socialism is the law governing the development of human society and this means the process in which the cause of socialism is emerging victorious, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article. 
					  It goes on:
					
					 Popular masses have always longed for a new social system protecting and bringing them independence and waged a strenuous struggle to realize their centuries-old desire under the system where the reactionary rulers lord it over, violating independence. 
					
					 Socialism is a sacred ideal and a revolutionary banner of the popular masses who struggle for independence. 
					
					 The popular masses could not achieve independence in the society ruled by hostile classes because it was the society based on individualism. 
					
					 The gap between the rich and the poor is widening in the capitalist countries due to the capitalist exploitation and plunder and, consequently, the sovereign rights of the toiling masses are wantonly violated. 
					
					 The deeper political and economic crisis capitalism finds itself in and the harsher the capitalist exploitation and oppression get, the fiercer the struggle of the working masses against them grow. 
					
					 As long as there are imperialist forces, the struggle of the world people against them will be intensified and in this course the cause of socialism is bound to triumph. 
					
					 The imperialists make last-ditch efforts to bring down socialism. This proves that socialism is a society indisputably superior to capitalism. 
					
					 Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses winning victory after victory as the days go by serves as a beacon of hope and a banner of victory for the progressive people who desire socialism or struggle to build it.

articles.title: Project for Laying Seawater Pipeline Makes Brisk Headway
articles.content:
Project for Laying Seawater Pipeline Makes Brisk Headway
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- The project for laying the Nampho-Pyongyang seawater pipeline is going great guns. 
					 The Pyongyang Bureau for the Management of Water Supply and Drainage System is pushing forward excavation for the pipeline and the construction of a seawater storage tank at a final phase in the wake of its successful completion of the pumping station for seawater supply.
					
					 Nampho City has almost finished the project for seawater deposition through a high-pitched drive for the seawater pipeline construction. 
					
					 The workers of Nampho Port and the Ryongnam Ship Repair Factory have registered signal successes by increasing the operation rate of machines and equipment. 
					
					 The Nampho Rural Economy Committee, the Nampho Koryo Medicine Production Management Bureau, the Nampho Essential Foodstuff Factory and other units have honored their quotas earlier than schedule. 
					
					 The city is now directing efforts to the construction of water intakes, pressure pumping stations, etc.

articles.title: New Stamp Issued
articles.content:
New Stamp Issued
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK has issued a new sheet showing the Chollima Statue. 
					 The stamp contains a picture of the statue portraying a worker and a peasant riding Chollima (legendary winged horse running 400 kilometers a day) and a picture of Moran Hill.
					
					 The statue, unveiled on April 15, Juche 50 (1961), is well known as a symbol of Korea.

articles.title: Taehongdan Revolutionary Battle Site
articles.content:
Taehongdan Revolutionary Battle Site
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Taehongdan in the northern part of the DPRK is a historic place where President Kim Il Sung fought a battle against the Japanese imperialists in May Juche 28 (1939) by leading a unit of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army.
					 The Victorious Musan Area Battle Memorial Tower with the statue of the President in its center is conspicuous in the place in Taehongdan County, Ryanggang Province.
					
					 The subsidiary sculptural groups in relief portray anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk, other guerrillas fighting against the Japanese imperialists and people aiding them with all sincerity.
					
					 Preserved in the place are the sites where the President commanded the battle, an operation plan was mapped out, and guerrillas gathered before attacking the enemy, as well as a sentry, spring and machinegun platform.
					
					 The historic place serves as a reminder of the great feats performed by the President in bringing the anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory.

articles.title: Quality of Foodstuffs, Daily Necessities Improved
articles.content:
Quality of Foodstuffs, Daily Necessities Improved 
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- The foodstuff and daily necessities industrial sectors have directed much effort to improving the quality of goods. 
					 After undergoing a technological updating of production processes, the Taedonggang Foodstuff Factory has developed ferment bacilli to better the quality of products. 
					
					 The Pyongyang Flour-Processing Factory, with the help of scientists, has made technological preparations to produce choice varieties of bread.
					
					 The Pyongyang and Sinuiju cosmetics factories have boosted the production of functional cosmetics like wrinkle-preventing creams, sunblock and aloe lotion.
					
					 The Changsong Foodstuff Factory, Hoeryong Essential Foodstuff Factory, Uiju Foodstuff Factory and many other locally-run factories have made various kinds of high-grade goods with raw materials available in their localities.

articles.title: Many Cutting Faces Prepared
articles.content:
Many Cutting Faces Prepared
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- More than 300 cutting faces have been prepared throughout the DPRK from the beginning of the year.
					 The Sunchon Area Youth Coal Mining Complex has raised coal output after finding out some 140 coal beds with large deposits and good mining conditions.
					
					 Scores of preparatory cutting faces have been provided by the Tokchon Area Coal Mining Complex and the Kaechon Area Coal Mining Complex.
					
					 Coal mines in Anju, Kangdong, Hamnam and Onsong areas have also prepared many cutting faces and boosted coal output.

articles.title: Utmost Sincerity for Patients
articles.content:
Utmost Sincerity for Patientsa
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang-based newspapers have introduced medical workers who treated patients in critical conditions with the utmost care.
					 Some time ago, a heart-failure patient was taken to Pyongyang College of Medicine Teaching Hospital under Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 The hospital had several consultations to take proper measures for treatment and mobilized all necessary apparatuses, as well as competent doctors.
					
					 Thanks to the utmost sincerity of the hospital's medical workers, the construction worker was restored to life.
					
					 Meanwhile, medical workers of the Kim Man Yu Hospital spared no sincerity to treat a patient suffering from pamplegia caused by neuro-optic myelitis. The patient returned to his health some 50 days after his admission to the hospital.
					
					 The patients owed their recovery to the free medical care system working in the country.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Assailed by Koreans in Europe
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Assailed by Koreans in Europe
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Europe held events in Germany from May 13 to 15 to mark the 31st anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising.
					 Present there together them were members of the May 18 Memorial Foundation, a civic organization in south Korea.
					
					 A memorial service took place as the first event.
					
					 At the service speakers referred to the significance of the uprising. They called upon all the fellow countrymen to pool their efforts to fight for the independent reunification of the country by inheriting the spirit of the May resistance.
					
					 The participants released a statement denouncing the crimes of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.
					
					 The statement blasted the erstwhile military dictatorial forces and their descendants of south Korea for adding to their crimes, far from repenting of their crimes.
					
					 The present conservative forces are defiling the May 18 resistance, it said, bitterly condemning the Lee Myung Bak regime for resorting to plots and swindles.
					
					 It branded the present regime's pursuance of the policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen, moves to derail inter-Korean dialogue, war maneuvers, the four large rivers project and enforcement of the policy on reducing taxes of the rich as acts going against the era and the people's mindset.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Moves Accused
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Moves Accused
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on May 16 as regards the third installment of the statement of the inspection group of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					 The inspection group, in the third installment of the statement, branded the incidents orchestrated by the pro-U.S. conservative Lee Myung Bak clique as militant provocations to the DPRK and disclosed the plots of the enemies including "story about north's involvement", the statement said, adding:
					
					 The intelligence service and the prosecutor's office of south Korea on May 3 announced the "north's involvement" in the case of paralyzed banking computer network of the "National Agricultural Cooperative Federation", in a bid to charge the DPRK with "cyber terror."
					
					 The south Korean war fanatics are also asserting that the DPRK may steadily damage such core facilities directly related to security as airport, harbor and nuclear power plant.
					
					 This impure and impudent assertion made by traitor Lee Myung Bak is aimed to challenge its surrounding countries urging the resumption of the north-south talks and find an excuse for the U.S. permanent occupation of south Korea.
					
					 We scathingly condemn the anti-DPRK moves of the south Korean puppet forces and express full solidarity with the DPRK which is taking all necessary measures for self-defence.

articles.title: S. Korea: Protesters against Jeju Naval Base Project Arrested
articles.content:
S. Korea: Protesters against Jeju Naval Base Project Arrested
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet police on May 19 walked away members of civic organizations including Ko Kwon Il, chairman of the Inhabitants Measure Committee against the Building of Jeju Naval Base, and inhabitants, eight in all.
					 The police arrested on the charge of "interference in execution of duty" those protestors who were staging a sit-in strike against the construction of the naval base in Kangjong village, Sogwipho City, Jeju Island.
					
					 The chief of the Sogwipho Police Station even threatened that they would walk away all of the inhabitants in the future.
					
					 That day the Inhabitants Measure Committee called a press conference in denunciation of the police's suppression, at which it strongly demanded an immediate halt to the construction of the base and release of those arrested.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Nepal
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Nepal
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Nepali organizations made public a joint statement on May 16 in support of the decision of the senior officials' meeting of the International Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They are the Nepal-Korea Friendship Association, the Nepal Institute for the Juche Studies and the Nepalese Committee for Supporting the Reunification of Korea. 
					
					 The centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung is a meaningful event to the progressive mankind praising him who made an immortal contribution to global independence, the statement said, adding:
					
					 The Nepal-Korea Friendship Association, the Nepal Institute for the Juche Studies and the Nepalese Committee for Supporting the Reunification of Korea, together with other social organizations of Nepal, will commemorate the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung with splendor.
					
					 We take this opportunity to extend our constant support and solidarity to the heroic Korean people in the efforts to achieve the peaceful reunification of the country while smashing all sorts of sinister moves of the imperialists and the reactionaries and build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation.
					
					 Kim Il Sung is always alive in the hearts of the world people aspiring after independence.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kwangju Popular Uprising Marked by British
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kwangju Popular Uprising Marked by British
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy on May 10 posted articles on its Internet homepage to mark the 31st anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising in south Korea.
					 In an article titled "Kwangju calls" the homepage referred to the uprising, saying:
					
					 The truth about the killings in Kwangju, the massacre of people unprecedented in history, can never be concealed and this tragedy will not fade out of the south Korean people's memory no matter how much water may flow under the bridge.
					
					 The root cause of all misfortune and sufferings the south Korean people are now undergoing is the U.S. imperialists' occupation of south Korea.
					
					 It is the U.S. imperialists that caused the bloody tragedy in Kwangju 31 years ago.
					
					 The south Korean people will struggle in close unity as one in the spirit of the Kwangju martyrs who fought a heroic fight, defying death and not yielding to immorality and dictatorship, and thus deal a sledge hammer of ruin to the Lee Myung Bak regime, a group of heinous traitors.
					
					 In an article titled "Due punishment" the homepage noted that the opposition parties overpowered the "Grand National Party" in the by-election held in south Korea.
					
					 The election returns is the south Korean people's stern punishment on the present conservative ruling forces hell-bent on sycophancy toward the U.S., fascist dictatorship and the moves against reunification and the DPRK, the article said.

articles.title: Cuba Slams U.S. Maneuvers against ALBA
articles.content:
Cuba Slams U.S. Maneuvers against ALBA
 Havana, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Cuban newspaper Granma on May 18 carried an article condemning the base moves of the U.S. to do harm to ALBA member nations.
					 The paper pointed out that the U.S. is set to hold a right-wing extremist meeting on Capitol Hill in Washington.
					
					 The right-wing assembly will claim that progressive Latin American countries have systematically violated rights of their citizens, it reported.
					
					 It said that the meeting is being promoted by the Americas Forum, a group that spreads dirty propaganda and misinformation against countries that do not obey the instructions of the U.S.
					
					 The chair of the U.S. House Foreign Affairs Committee is behind the maneuvers against ALBA, it noted.

articles.title: Pakistani Army Lodges Protest over NATO Incursion
articles.content:
Pakistani Army Lodges Protest over NATO Incursion
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- The Pakistani army in a statement on Tuesday lodged protest against NATO which intruded into its air space.
					 Two NATO helicopters in Afghanistan violated Pakistan air space at Admi Kot Post, North Waziristan Agency that day, the statement said, adding that the troops at the post fired upon the helicopters and, as a result of exchange of fire, two of our soldiers received injuries.

articles.title: Hezbollah Condemns U.S. Sanctions on Syria
articles.content:
Hezbollah Condemns U.S. Sanctions on Syria
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Hezbollah, a patriotic forces organization of Lebanon, in a statement on May 19 condemned U.S. sanctions on Syria.
					 U.S. President Barack Obama imposed Wednesday asset freezes and restrictions on financial transactions on Assad and six top aides, the statement noted.
					
					 It said the new sanctions were meant as a punishment against Syria and its people for supporting the resistant movements of Lebanese and Palestinians against Israel and the U.S. 
					
					 "U.S. interference will not stop the Syrian people and the (Syrian) leadership from committing to the righteous causes of the nation," it added.

articles.title: Israeli Army Arrests Six Palestinians in West Bank
articles.content:
Israeli Army Arrests Six Palestinians in West Bank
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- The Israeli army is busy with the arrest of Palestinians.
					 The Israeli army raided a number of houses in the West bank Thursday and arrested six Palestinians.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Turkey
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Turkey
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- A 5.9-magnitude earthquake hit western Turkey on May 19.
					 The epicenter of the quake was Simav town in western province of Kutahya.
					
					 The quake left three persons dead and about 100 wounded and destroyed several buildings.
					
					 The electricity supply to inhabitants was suspended and telephone lines cut off.

articles.title: Russia's Stand on MD in Europe Clarified
articles.content:
Russia's Stand on MD in Europe Clarified
 Moscow, May 21 (KCNA) -- Nikolai Makarov, chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, in a seminar on May 20 clarified the stand of his country on the missile defense system the U.S. seeks to deploy in Europe.
					 Russia should participate in all stages of the U.S. MD in Europe, he said, stressing that what is important is to remove the threat to his country.
					
					 As long as the U.S. denies Russia's proposals concerning the issue of the MD in Europe, the Russian government will accept it as part of the U.S. world MD, he declared.

articles.title: New Magazine Founded in China
articles.content:
New Magazine Founded in China
 Beijing, May 21 (KCNA) -- Magazine "Defense Education" was founded in China recently. It is a periodical publication managed by the National Office for Defense Education Affairs.
					 The purpose of the magazine is to help readers deeply study the theory of defense education, disseminate defense knowledge, policies and law and regulations and inform them of successes made in national defense and army building.

articles.title: China Attaches Importance to Vocational and Adult Education
articles.content:
China Attaches Importance to Vocational and Adult Education
 Beijing, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Ministry of Education convened a 2011 national tele-conference for vocational and adult education in Beijing on May 16.
					 The conference discussed the issue of promoting the harmonious development of secondary and higher vocational education by giving impetus to establishing a modern vocational education system.
					
					 It proposed new tasks for the development of vocational education during the 12th five-year plan and took measures for improving vocational and adult education this year.

articles.title: Russia Calls for Efforts to Settle Arab-Israeli Dispute
articles.content:
Russia Calls for Efforts to Settle Arab-Israeli Dispute 
 Moscow, May 21 (KCNA) -- The Russian Foreign Ministry called upon the international community to make efforts to solve the recent Arab-Israeli dispute.
					 Russia expresses deep concern over the fact that Israeli forces fired at Palestinians in demonstrations in occupied Palestinian territory and along various areas bordering on Lebanon, Syria and Jordan, causing many casualties, the ministry said.
					
					 It demanded Israel stop violence.

articles.title: Russia Expels Israeli Military Attache
articles.content:
Russia Expels Israeli Military Attache
 Moscow, May 21 (KCNA) -- Russia arrested and expelled Vadim Liderman, Israel Defense Forces military attache in Russia on suspicion of spying.
					 RiaÔºçNovosti of Russia on Thursday said that he was expelled for his involvement in industrial espionage, to be specific, for his excessive help to Israeli munitions companies in their activities on Russian market.

articles.title: 1,551 Macrobians in Cuba
articles.content:
1,551 Macrobians in Cuba
 Havana, May 21 (KCNA) -- There are 1,551 Macrobians above 100 years old in Cuba at present. This is an increase of 10 over that last year, Cuban newspaper Granma said.

articles.title: Lauded by Russian and Chinese Media
articles.content:
Lauded by Russian and Chinese Media
 Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Media of Russia and China on May 18 reported about the fact that general secretary Kim Jong Il has made endless forced march based on patriotic devotion for the development of the nation's light industry.
					 The Vesti 24 TV of Russia said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, kindled the fierce flames for the development of the light industry throughout the country.
					
					 He gave field guidance to about 80 units for the development of the light industry after kindling the torch of new great revolutionary surge. This is equivalent to visits to two odd units on the average every month.
					
					 During his field guidance he stressed that any factory should be built to meet the demand of the new century and bring substantial benefit to the people.
					
					 An Internet homepage of China carried under the title "Leader Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to About 80 Units for Bringing Heyday of Light Industry" news that he has devotedly worked for the development of the light industry.

articles.title: Iniciada la construccion de la zona de Mansudae
articles.content:
Iniciada la construccion de la zona de Mansudae
 Pyongyang, 23 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 22 en la zona de Mansudae la ceremonia de los constructores para dar inicio a la obra de acondicionarla en el maximo nivel con motivo del centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					 En esta zona, donde esta enclavada la estatua de bronce del Presidente, se levantaran a las alturas del nuevo siglo modernas viviendas y edificios monumentales rodeados de parques.
					
					 Cuando se cumpla ese proyecto, se dara un avance trascendental en la conversion de esta capital en una ciudad de talla mundial y la hermosa y majestuosa del pueblo.
					
					 En la ceremonia participaron Choe  Yong  Rim, Kim Yong Chun y otros cuadros, los funcionarios de ministerios y organos centrales y de esta capital, y decenas de miles de constructores.
					
					 El premier Choe Yong Rim, en el informe de la ocasion, senalo que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il propuso esa obra y tomo las medidas revolucionarias para resolver los problemas surgidos en la marcha de ella que van desde el diseno y la formacion de las brigadas de construccion hasta el suministro de materiales. 
					
					 Los funcionarios y los constructores deben asegurar en el maximo nivel la calidad de todas las creaciones observando rigurosamente las exigencias de diseno, ejecucion y metodos de construccion, bajo la consigna de "!Nos responsabilicemos en mil anos y garanticemos diez mil anos!", destaco.
					
					 Enfatizo que bajo la direccion del gran partido, ellos deben ser triunfadores orgullosos en la ofensiva general para acondicionar magnificamente la zona de Mansudae con motivo del centenario del natalicio del Presidente levantando en alto la consigna de "!Si Corea decide, lo cumple!" 
					
					 El director general de la Construccion Capital, Yang In Guk, el ministro de la Industria Metalurgica, Kim Thae Bong, el gerente del Complejo de Cemento de Sangwon, Ho Song Gil, expresaron en sus discursos la decision de contribuir a la finalizacion adelantada de la obra cuya forma, dimension y periodo no tienen precedentes en la historia de construccion de esta capital.

articles.title: En Pyongyang una delegacion de EE.UU.
articles.content:
En Pyongyang una delegacion de EE.UU
 Pyongyang, 23 de mayo (ATCC) -- Llego el dia 23 a esta capital por avion la delegacion de la Sociedad Asiatica de Estados Unidos encabezada por su presidenta Vishakha Nirubhai Desai.

articles.title: Victoria del socialismo es ley de desarrollo historico
articles.content:
Victoria del socialismo es ley de desarrollo historico 
 Pyongyang, 23 de mayo (ATCC) -- La transicion del capitalismo al socialismo es una ley del desarrollo social de la humanidad y el proceso de la causa socialista hacia la victoria.
					 Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual del dia 23 y prosigue:
					
					 En el regimen social donde senorea la clase dominante reaccionaria que viola la independencia, las masas populares vinieron aspirando de siglo en siglo a un nuevo regimen social, que pueda defender y verificar su independencia, y luchando por realizar ese deseo.
					
					 El socialismo es el noble ideal y la bandera revolucionaria de las masas populares que luchan por la independencia.
					
					 La sociedad de clases antagonicas no puede verificar la independencia de ellas porque se basa en el individualismo.
					
					 Como resultado de la explotacion y saqueo capitalistas, se agranda la ya abismal diferencia entre los ricos y los pobres y se ven violados flagrantemente los derechos independientes de las masas populares trabajadoras.
					
					 Cada vez que cae el capitalismo en la seria crisis politica y economica y se recrudecen la explotacion y opresion del capital, se torna mas intensa la lucha de las masas trabajadoras.
					
					 Mientras existan las fuerzas imperialistas, se intensificara mas la lucha de los pueblos del mundo y en este proceso triunfara sin falta la causa socialista.
					
					 El hecho de que los imperialistas maniobran desesperadamente para exterminar el socialismo demuestra fehacientemente que el socialismo es la sociedad muy ventajosa en comparacion con el capitalismo.
					
					 El socialismo coreano centrado en las masas populares, que avanza cada dia mas victorioso, sirve del faro de esperanza y la bandera de victoria de los pueblos progresistas que aspiran al socialismo o luchan por construirlo.

articles.title: Entidades nepaleses apoyan resolucion de reunion internacional
articles.content:
Entidades nepaleses apoyan resolucion de reunion internacional
 Pyongyang, 23 de mayo (ATCC) -- La Asociacion de Amistad Nepal-Corea, el Instituto Nepales por los Estudios del Juche y el Comite Nepales de Apoyo a la Reunificacion de Corea hicieron publica el dia 16 una declaracion conjunta en apoyo a la resolucion adoptada en la reunion consultiva de los funcionarios directivos del comite preparatorio internacional para el centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					 El documento senala que dicha efemeride coreana deviene un acontecimiento significativo para la humanidad progresista que elogia al Presidente quien acumulo imborrables proezas ante la causa de independencia mundial.
					
					 Asevera que la Asociacion de Amistad Nepal-Corea, el Instituto Nepales por los Estudios del Juche y el Comite Nepales de Apoyo a la Reunificacion de Corea celebraran con solemnidad el centenario cumpleanos del  Presidente junto con otras entidades sociales de Nepal.
					
					 En esta oportunidad expresamos nuestro invariable apoyo y solidaridad con el heroico pueblo coreano que lucha por lograr la reunificacion pacifica de la patria y construir una gran potencia prospera socialista frustrando todas las maniobras groseras de los imperialistas y otros reaccionarios, destaca.
					
					 El Presidente Kim Il Sung esta vivo siempre en el corazon de los pueblos del mundo aspirantes a la independencia, concluye.
